document_data.caption: ''Faceted purple spodumene.''
document_data.name: Spodumene
document_data.mainbody:
{{Wikipedia article|spodumene}}
'''Spodumene''' was also known as [[wikipedia:en:kunzite|kunzite]] or [[wikipedia:en:hiddenite|hiddenite]], depending on the color.
document_data.Description: Spodumene came in two distinct color families each with their own name. Stones in the pink to purple range were known as kunzite while the emerald-green variety was called hiddenite. Both types were hard, easily cleaved, durable, and produced beautiful large faceted gems. A typical specimen had a base value of 50 gp.
document_data.Powers: If this stone was sprinkled with holy water (at least three drops) it had the ability to open ''[[wizard lock]]ed'' doors and items on contact. The gemstone was not consumed by this, but the holy water was used up the spodumene had to be anointed for each attempt.
